subject: Track and Field
Olympic Games
lead_paragraph: Marion Jones’s former relay teammates have appealed a decision by the International Olympic Committee to strip them of their gold medals with the Court of Arbitration for Sport in Lausanne, Switzerland, their lawyer, Mark Levinstein, said. The International Olympic Committee ruled in April that the teammates who won gold in the 4x400 meter and bronze in the 4x100 meter for the United States at the 2000 Sydney Games were disqualified because Jones admitted to using performance-enhancing drugs during that period.
